body:
> I don't know how to see Gijs' comments except for the one about startup and pre-existing profiles. You should still make changes or take into account that feedback.

You can click "Show outdated" next to the grey boxes around that comment to see his old review comments. I already applied the feedback from his comments before asking you to review, but Github is still storing his rejection from the previous review. I just didn't know if he wanted to do another pass himself or just dismiss his old rejection so that it doesn't disable the UI for merging.
body_text:
I don't know how to see Gijs' comments except for the one about startup and pre-existing profiles. You should still make changes or take into account that feedback.

You can click "Show outdated" next to the grey boxes around that comment to see his old review comments. I already applied the feedback from his comments before asking you to review, but Github is still storing his rejection from the previous review. I just didn't know if he wanted to do another pass himself or just dismiss his old rejection so that it doesn't disable the UI for merging.
body_html:
I don't know how to see Gijs' comments except for the one about startup and pre-existing profiles. You should still make changes or take into account that feedback.

You can click "Show outdated" next to the grey boxes around that comment to see his old review comments. I already applied the feedback from his comments before asking you to review, but Github is still storing his rejection from the previous review. I just didn't know if he wanted to do another pass himself or just dismiss his old rejection so that it doesn't disable the UI for merging.
